original: yul gang dag 'byor pa dang; rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye bo dang / mi mang pos gang ba de dag tu yang song nas /🔽bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa /
analyzed: yul gang dag 'byor pa dang; rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye bo dang / mi mang pos gang ba de dag tu yang song nas / bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa /
translated: and wherever there were prosperous, flourishing, happy, and well-populated countries,🔽he went there and filled his alms bowl with clean, wholesome food

original: kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang ldan pas lhung bzed bkang ste khyer nas /
analyzed: kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang ldan pas lhung bzed bkang ste khyer nas /
translated: that was good in color, smell, and taste.

original: bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyod /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyod /
translated: He ate it himself,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yod pa dag la yang bgo bsha' byed do //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yod pa dag la yang bgo bsha' byed do //
translated: and shared it with the fellow practitioners.🔽Then Devadatta thought,

original: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Devadatta thought,

original: de ltar mu ge mi bzad pa dgon pa slong mo pas zas rnyed par dka' ba byung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: de ltar mu ge mi bzad pa dgon pa slong mo pas zas rnyed par dka' ba byung ngo snyam mo //
translated: “ ‘Thus, a terrible famine has occurred, and it is difficult for the mendicants to find food in the wilderness.’

original: yang lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “Then Devadatta thought,

original: bdag gis kyang rdzu 'phrul thob par byas la /🔽bdag kyang gang gis ming 'dzam bu zhes bya bas /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rdzu 'phrul thob par byas la / bdag kyang gang gis ming 'dzam bu zhes bya bas /
translated: ‘I too should attain miraculous powers.🔽I too should go to the place known as Jambudvīpa,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du shes pa der song la /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du shes pa der song la /
translated: where there is a tree called Jambu,

original: shing 'dzam bu'i snye ma kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang ldan pa rnams kyis lhung bzed bkang ste blangs nas /
analyzed: shing 'dzam bu'i snye ma kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang ldan pa rnams kyis lhung bzed bkang ste blangs nas /
translated: whose fruits are colorful, fragrant, and delicious.🔽I will fill my alms bowl with them,

original: bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyod par bya /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyod par bya /
translated: eat them myself,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa yod pa dag la yang bgo bsha' bya'o //🔽de bzhin du yul gang dag 'byor pa dang / rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye @185a *//
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa yod pa dag la yang bgo bsha' bya'o // de bzhin du yul gang dag 'byor pa dang / rgyas pa dang / bde ba dang / lo legs pa dang / skye @185a *//
translated: and share them with the learned fellow practitioners of pure conduct.

original: bo dang / mi mang pos gang ba de dag tu yang song la /
analyzed: bo dang / mi mang pos gang ba de dag tu yang song la /
translated: In the same way, I will go to the places that are wealthy, prosperous, peaceful, abundant in food, and full of many people.

original: bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang ldan pas lhung bzed bkang ste blangs nas bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyod par bya /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / bca' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang ldan pas lhung bzed bkang ste blangs nas bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyod par bya /
translated: and pure, wholesome food, with good color, smell, and taste, and fill his begging bowl. He should then enjoy it himself.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa yod pa dag la yang bgo bsha' bya'o snyam mo //🔽yang lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa yod pa dag la yang bgo bsha' bya'o snyam mo // yang lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: I will eat and enjoy it myself, and share it with the learned practitioners of pure conduct.”

original: ma la bdag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'gro'o snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la bdag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'gro'o snyam mo //
translated: Then Devadatta thought, “I will go to the Blessed One.”

original: de nas lhas byin bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then Devadatta went to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: When he arrived, he bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet,

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: and then he sat down to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la lhas byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan du gsol /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la lhas byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan du gsol /
translated: When he had sat down to one side, Devadatta said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, please teach me the path of miracles.

original: bde bar gshegs pa bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan du gsol /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan du gsol /
translated: Sugata, please teach me the path of miracles.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Blessed One,

original: lhas byin gyi 'dod pa sdig pa can du gyur pa thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi 'dod pa sdig pa can du gyur pa thugs su chud nas /
translated: knowing Devadatta’s sinful desire,

original: lhas byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lhas byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: said this to Devadatta:

original: lhas byin re zhig lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brtson par gyis shig dang / khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang / gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin re zhig lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brtson par gyis shig dang / khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang / gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Devadatta, for the time being, strive in the higher morality, and you will have magical powers and other qualities.

original: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la brtson par gyis shig dang / khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang / gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la brtson par gyis shig dang / khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang / gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Strive in the higher mind and the higher wisdom, and you will have magical powers and other qualities.”

original: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Devadatta thought this:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag la rdzu 'phrul @185b gyi lam mi ston to snyam du rig nas /🔽lhas byin tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag la rdzu 'phrul @185b gyi lam mi ston to snyam du rig nas / lhas byin tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: “The Blessed One does not teach me the path of magical powers.”

original: kun shes ko'u di n+ya la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: kun shes ko'u di n+ya la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Knowing this, Devadatta went to the venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya and said this:

original: gnas brtan bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam ston cig /
analyzed: gnas brtan bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam ston cig /
translated: “Elder, teach me the path of magical powers.”🔽“Very well,” he said, and taught him the path of magical powers.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya sa bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs la rnam par bltas te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya sa bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs la rnam par bltas te /
translated: Then the Venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya looked into the mind of the Blessed One.

original: de'i 'dod pa sdig pa can du gyur par rig nas /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa sdig pa can du gyur par rig nas /
translated: Knowing that his desire was sinful,

original: lhas byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lhas byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: he said this to Devadatta:

original: lhas byin gzugs tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang / khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang / gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin gzugs tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang / khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang / gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Devadatta, properly attend to form, and you will have magical powers and other abilities.🔽Properly attend to feeling…🔽perception…🔽volitional factors…

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang / khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang / khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: consciousness, and you will have magical powers and other abilities.”

original: lhas byin gyis 'od srung stobs bcu pa las rdzu 'phrul bsgrubs te /
analyzed: lhas byin gyis 'od srung stobs bcu pa las rdzu 'phrul bsgrubs te /
translated: Devadatta accomplished magical powers from Kāśyapa the Powerful.

original: de gcig tu gyur nas du mar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de gcig tu gyur nas du mar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He became one and then many.

original: re zhig na sems yongs su gtugs pa de la 'dod pa sdig pa can du gyur pa 'di lta bu byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig na sems yongs su gtugs pa de la 'dod pa sdig pa can du gyur pa 'di lta bu byung ste /
translated: Then, when his mind was exhausted, this sinful desire arose in him:🔽“If I were the Buddha,

original: da ltar bcom ldan 'das bgres 'khogs gtugs pas 'khor bzhi po la gdams pa mnyel bas kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bdag la gtad de /
analyzed: da ltar bcom ldan 'das bgres 'khogs gtugs pas 'khor bzhi po la gdams pa mnyel bas kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bdag la gtad de /
translated: Alas, it would be good if the Blessed One entrusted the community of monks to me,

original: bdag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun yongs su drang zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis dge slong gi dge 'dun yongs su drang zhing /
translated: and I would lead the community of monks.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson zhing thugs las chung ngur bzhugs kyang ci ma rung snyam mo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson zhing thugs las chung ngur bzhugs kyang ci ma rung snyam mo //
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One, who is now old, aged, and advanced in years, were to live at ease, engaging in the yoga of abiding in comfort in this very life and taking little trouble with it.

original: ji tsam na lhas byin bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der phyin nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na lhas byin bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der phyin nas /
translated: Then Devadatta went to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: @186a *// bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to /
analyzed: @186a *// bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to /
translated: and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das da ltar bgres 'khogs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das da ltar bgres 'khogs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Blessed One, now that you are old, aged, and advanced in years,

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson zhing zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson zhing zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: it would be good if you were to live at ease, engaging in the yoga of abiding in comfort in this very life and taking little trouble with it.”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: When he had thus spoken, the Blessed One said to Devadatta:

original: lhas byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽skyes bu gti mug ngas re zhig tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa /
analyzed: lhas byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // skyes bu gti mug ngas re zhig tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa /
translated: “Devadatta, you are a fool.

original: des pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mo'u 'gal gyi bu dag la yang dge slong gi dge 'dun mi gtad na /
analyzed: des pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mo'u 'gal gyi bu dag la yang dge slong gi dge 'dun mi gtad na /
translated: I would not entrust the community of monks to the wise Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, even for a little while.

original: mchil ma 'thung ba ro khyod la lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang; lhas sbyin khros 'khrugs nas mgo lan gsum gcogs te mjal to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mchil ma 'thung ba ro khyod la lta smos kyang ci dgos / de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang; lhas sbyin khros 'khrugs nas mgo lan gsum gcogs te mjal to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: How much less to you, who are like a man who drinks his own spittle!”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo /
translated: When he had thus spoken, Devadatta, angry and displeased, shook his head, bared his breast, and departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas lhas byin de phyin chad dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi dbyen bya bar brtsams so //
analyzed: de nas lhas byin de phyin chad dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi dbyen bya bar brtsams so //
translated: After that, Devadatta began to cause a schism in the community of monks.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ma sbom dga' mo zhes bya bas kyang /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ma sbom dga' mo zhes bya bas kyang /
translated: At that time, the nun Thullanandā

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi dbyen bya bar 'bad pa brtsams pa dang / dge slong ma rnams kyis de 'bad pa rtsom par 'phrigs so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi dbyen bya bar 'bad pa brtsams pa dang / dge slong ma rnams kyis de 'bad pa rtsom par 'phrigs so //
translated: The nuns realized that she was making efforts to do so.

original: skabs de dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong dag la smras so //
analyzed: skabs de dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong dag la smras so //
translated: The nuns told the monks what had happened.

original: dge slong dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; dge slong ma khyed kyis sbom dga' mo la bzhams te bsgo zhig /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; dge slong ma khyed kyis sbom dga' mo la bzhams te bsgo zhig /
translated: The monks then told the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said, “Monks, you must admonish the nun Sthūlanandā.”

original: bzhams te bsgo ba yang 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: bzhams te bsgo ba yang 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: “The admonishment should be done as follows.

original: sbom dga' mo khyod dge slong ma'i dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir ma 'jug @186b cig /
analyzed: sbom dga' mo khyod dge slong ma'i dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir ma 'jug @186b cig /
translated: ‘Sthūlanandā, do not cause a schism in the community of nuns.

original: dbye bar bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa yang dag par bzung nas /
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i phyir rtsod pa yang dag par bzung nas /
translated: Do not hold on to a dispute that will cause a schism.

original: rab tu 'dzin cing ma 'dug cig /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin cing ma 'dug cig /
translated: Do not hold on to it.

original: sbom dga' mo khyod dge 'dun dang mthun par gyis shig /
analyzed: sbom dga' mo khyod dge 'dun dang mthun par gyis shig /
translated: Sthūlanandā, be in harmony with the community.

original: dge 'dun mthun /
analyzed: dge 'dun mthun /
translated: The community is harmonious,

original: mi phyed / kun tu dga' mi rtsod de /
analyzed: mi phyed / kun tu dga' mi rtsod de /
translated: not divided, and is living happily without dispute.

original: rtse gcig la 'don pa gcig cing chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres pa lta bur gyur la /
analyzed: rtse gcig la 'don pa gcig cing chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres pa lta bur gyur la /
translated: It is like water and milk mixed together.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you illuminate the teachings of the Teacher, you will come to abide in bliss.

original: sbom dga' mo khyod kyis dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i gzhi de lta bu thong zhig /
analyzed: sbom dga' mo khyod kyis dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i gzhi de lta bu thong zhig /
translated: “Pramudita, you should give up the basis for creating a schism in the saṅgha.

original: de la de skad du bzhams te bsgo yang gzhi de nyid la phyir zhing nan gyis mchog tu bzung nas 'di kho nar bden gyi /
analyzed: de la de skad du bzhams te bsgo yang gzhi de nyid la phyir zhing nan gyis mchog tu bzung nas 'di kho nar bden gyi /
translated: Even though you are admonished in this way, you continue to insist on this basis, saying, ‘This alone is the truth.

original: gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs so //🔽dge slong ma de'i grogs mo rnams kyang dge slong ma de dag la 'di skad ces zer te /🔽phu nu mo khyod dge slong ma 'di la dge yang rung /
analyzed: gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs so // dge slong ma de'i grogs mo rnams kyang dge slong ma de dag la 'di skad ces zer te / phu nu mo khyod dge slong ma 'di la dge yang rung /
translated: The others are confused.’

original: sdig kyang rung cung zad kyang smra zhig /
analyzed: sdig kyang rung cung zad kyang smra zhig /
translated: “The friends of that bhikṣuṇī say to those bhikṣuṇīs, ‘Sisters, do not say anything good or bad about this bhikṣuṇī.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dge slong ma 'di ni chos smra ba /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / dge slong ma 'di ni chos smra ba /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dul ba smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba smra ba ste /
translated: This bhikṣuṇī is a dharmabhāṇaka.🔽She is a vinaya bhāṇaka.

original: 'di ni chos dang 'dul ba yang dag par blangs nas rab tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: 'di ni chos dang 'dul ba yang dag par blangs nas rab tu 'dzin cing /
translated: “This nun has taken up the Dharma and Vinaya well and upholds it well.

original: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pas dge slong ma 'di shes bzhin du smra'i; mi shes par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pas dge slong ma 'di shes bzhin du smra'i; mi shes par ni ma yin no //
translated: She speaks with knowledge, not without knowledge.

original: dge slong ma 'di gang la 'dod cing bzod pa de la /
analyzed: dge slong ma 'di gang la 'dod cing bzod pa de la /
translated: This nun is one who desires and accepts.

original: nged kyang 'dod cing bzod do //
analyzed: nged kyang 'dod cing bzod do //
translated: We also desire and accept what she desires and accepts.”

original: de nas dge slong ma rab tu mang po bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma rab tu mang po bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then many nuns went to the Blessed One, and after arriving,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: they bowed their heads at the Blessed One’s feet

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis sbom dga' mo la bzhams te bsgo lags te /🔽de bzhams te @187a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis sbom dga' mo la bzhams te bsgo lags te / de bzhams te @187a *//
translated: “Blessed One, we have admonished Śubhaṅkarā in a conciliatory way,🔽and when we admonished her in a conciliatory way,

original: bsgo ba na gzhi de nyid la nan gyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bsgo ba na gzhi de nyid la nan gyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: she insisted on the basis of that, saying,

original: gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //🔽dge slong ma de'i grogs mo rnams kyang /
analyzed: gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o // dge slong ma de'i grogs mo rnams kyang /
translated: ‘The others are ignorant.’🔽The friends of that nun🔽also said this to those nuns:

original: dge slong ma de dag la 'di skad ces mchi ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma de dag la 'di skad ces mchi ste /
translated: “Venerables,

original: phu nu mo khyod dge slong ma 'di la cung zad kyang ma smra zhig ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: phu nu mo khyod dge slong ma 'di la cung zad kyang ma smra zhig ces bya ba nas /
translated: “Sister, do not say anything at all about this nun.”

original: de la nged kyang 'dod cing bzod do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de la nged kyang 'dod cing bzod do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: “We agree and accept what she says.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong ma khyed kyis dge slong ma de dag dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dag la bzhams te bsgo zhig /
analyzed: dge slong ma khyed kyis dge slong ma de dag dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dag la bzhams te bsgo zhig /
translated: “Monks, you should admonish those nuns and others like them.

original: bsgo ba yang 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: bsgo ba yang 'di ltar bya ste /
